page.title: 09Vanishing trees & hedgerows
page.content: This area comprises a patchwork of fields divided by hedgerows and trees. However, some hedgerows (including blackberry bushes) have been removed where crops have grown. There are fewer mature trees, as all of the elms were destroyed by disease. The elms still standing are gradually becoming ivy- covered. Rooks now seem to nest happily in smaller trees, although some still use dead elms. Fields bordering the River Ock were once marsh, and were subject to flooding, until the river level was lowered in l979.
